results.headline: ‘Shoplifters’ Review: A Family That Steals Together, Stays Together
results.summary_short: In this beautifully felt drama, the Japanese director Hirokazu Kore-eda dives into the mess of life with a story about a family on the ragged edge.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shoplifters

results.headline: ‘Becoming Astrid’ Review: A Children’s Author Finds Her Voice
results.summary_short: This biopic of the Swedish writer of the “Pippi Longstocking” series hits familiar beats, but its performances are pitch perfect.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Becoming Astrid

results.headline: ‘Inquiring Nuns’ Review: A Simple Question Yields Many Profound Answers
results.summary_short: In this newly restored 1968 documentary, two nuns ask a variety of passers-by in Chicago: “Are you happy?”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Inquiring Nuns

results.headline: ‘Invisible Hands’ Review: The Children Fueling Global Capitalism
results.summary_short: Shraysi Tandon’s dense investigative documentary jumps into the murky and shameful world of child trafficking and forced labor.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Invisible Hands

results.headline: ‘Family in Transition’ Review: A Parent Prepares for Change
results.summary_short: The documentary tells the story of Amit Tsuk, who comes out as transgender, and the effect it has on the family.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Family in Transition

results.headline: ‘Write When You Get Work’ Review: Backstreet Boy Seeks Uptown Girl
results.summary_short: A petty thief stalks his former lover in Stacy Cochran’s messy, maddening New York City romance.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Write When You Get Work

results.headline: ‘The Favourite’ Review: Scheming for Power in a Kinky Palace Triangle
results.summary_short: Yorgos Lanthimos’s new film, starring Olivia Colman, Emma Stone and Rachel Weisz, turns 18th-century royal intrigue into sublime and ridiculous comedy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Favourite

results.headline: ‘Roma’ Review: Alfonso Cuarón’s Masterpiece of Memory
results.summary_short: Cuarón uses both intimacy and monumentality to express the depths of ordinary life in this autobiographical movie set in Mexico City in the 1970s.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Roma

results.headline: ‘Creed II’ Review: A Poignant Boxing Movie Blends Old and New
results.summary_short: Michael B. Jordan, Tessa Thompson and Sylvester Stallone reunite in a terrific follow-up to “Creed.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Creed II

results.headline: ‘The World Before Your Feet’ Review: Walk a Mile — or 8,000 — in Another Man’s Shoes
results.summary_short: Not everyone can spend several years walking every block of New York. But spending 90 minutes doing that in this documentary is swell.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The World Before Your Feet

results.headline: ‘Robin Hood’ Review: A New Version Strains to Be Relevant
results.summary_short: This is not your father’s, or grandfather’s, “Robin Hood,” and it’s not very good, either.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Robin Hood

results.headline: ‘¡Las Sandinistas!’ Review: Women Remember Revolution in Nicaragua
results.summary_short: In focusing on the testimonies of women, the documentary aims to memorialize an overlooked feminist “revolution inside the revolution.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Las Sandinistas!

results.headline: ‘Ralph Breaks the Internet’ Review: Disney Gets Caught in the Web
results.summary_short: John C. Reilly and Sarah Silverman return to voice the characters in this social satire sequel that is downright scary.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ralph Breaks the Internet

results.headline: ‘At Eternity’s Gate’ Review: An Exquisite Portrayal of van Gogh at Work
results.summary_short: A magnificent Willem Dafoe stars in Julian Schnabel’s film, a work that Manohla Dargis calls “an argument for art.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of At Eternity's Gate

results.headline: ‘Green Book’ Review: A Road Trip Through a Land of Racial Clichés
results.summary_short: A real-life story starring Mahershala Ali and Viggo Mortensen becomes a feel-good fable buoyed by its lead performances.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Green Book

results.headline: ‘Of Fathers and Sons’ Review: A Look at Terrorists in Training
results.summary_short: In this documentary a filmmaker embeds himself with a jihadist family, presenting himself as a sympathizer, but sheds little light on their inner lives.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Of Fathers and Sons

results.headline: ‘Miss Dalí’ Review: A Disorienting Biography of Surrealist’s Sister
results.summary_short: Anna Maria Dalí died four months after her brother, Salvador Dalí. This film is set during that period and is full of reminiscence.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Miss Dalí

results.headline: ‘Instant Family’ Review: The Adoption Option, Hollywood Style
results.summary_short: “Instant Family” is a Sean Anders comedy with good intentions that’s not entirely hellish, but is reliably anodyne.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Instant Family

results.headline: ‘The Last Race’ Review: Long Island’s Fading Car Craze
results.summary_short: This documentary explores the region’s long history of auto racing and the lively and eccentric culture it attracted.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Last Race

results.headline: ‘Mobile Homes’ Review: Imogen Poots Gives a Riveting Performance
results.summary_short: In this film about a troubled, unwed mother, director Vladimir de Fontenay struggles to match the expressive power of his lead actress.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mobile Homes
